title: Why is Lori Lightfoot so popular? - Quora

response.answer_text: She rises to the top of a shallow pool, so to speak. She’s only “popular” in comparison to who she’s running against. Here are the results from yesterday’s election:  Keep in mind that Chicago is a city of three million people, about 1.5 million of whom are registered voters. If “none of the above” were an option, and people were forced to vote, she would have finished second to… literally no one. That being said, her rhetoric, at least, is much better than Preckwinkle. Preckwinkle said a lot of Bernie Sanders-esque things about “making the rich pay their fair share.” To the indifferent observer, like me (I don’t support either of them), Preckwinkle’s rhetoric was often about “us vs. them.” Police vs. people of color, rich vs. poor, downtown vs. everyone else, etc… Lightfoot’s rhetoric was more focused on “we’re all in this together.” Even though I don’t believe she actually thinks that, it was still refreshing to hear a Chicago politician not demonize the rich/police/downtown business district.

1)She’s the first black woman elected mayor 2)she’s the first LGBT elected mayor 3)she’s NOT a politician, which seems to be the new trend but most important to me is she has a proven track record of anti corruption!I watched the politicians in Chicago run as much side game as they could. It’s what eventually drove me into the suburbs. Now the last of the old school machine politicians is going to prison, O’connor Who is crooked as hell lost his election as did Arena and a few others are going down with Burke. She’ll be starting with a lot of fresh faces that aren’t entrenched in the cesspool is favors for campaign donations, I think knowing she has actually put aldermen in jail will keep the new people in line. She’s popular because we’re hopeful… the Republicans are even hopeful that the culture will shift, that’s all we all want after watching the fat cats get richer and the neighborhoods get the leftover scraps
